channel.title: Go on Feggah
channel.description: Recent content in Go on Feggah

item.title: Byte or rune: is there any difference?
item.description: When you are creating algorithms to deal with strings in Go, especially when using for loops, it’s common to use either a regular for loop (using each item of the slice as a byte) or a for range loop (using each item as a rune). When choosing which one to use, you could have asked youself “Is there any difference?”. That’s what we are going to talk about in this post.
